channel.title: Posts
channel.description: How many posts equals what rank?

item.title: Posts
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

20000+ = Davidi2
1000+ = Moparian
250+ = Senior Member
100+ = Member
5+ = Junior Member
1-4 = First Time Poster
0 = CBA To Post

Read full topic

item.title: Posts
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:38, topic:467112”][quote author=Niall link=topic=584046.msg4157373#msg4157373 date=1352771424]

There is a feeling of elitism by some foolish members, and typically discrimination towards newer members. Just saying it would eliminate these issues.

in my experience the ‘discrimination against newer members’ generally occurs when said newer member acts like an arrogant self-entitled pompous ass, this is not always the case but when newer members ask how to do something, ignoring the dozens of existing stickies and threads that will help him solve said problems they aren’t doing themselves any favours
[/quote]
It just seems that there is a general lack of agreement with newer members, be they smart or dumb. People seem to just have less regard for the statements or actions they do unless they put themselves out there to prove worthiness. However, at a later period, change can be present in a negative term.

For example, let’s look at team rocket. When he joined, he was immediately strongly out spoken with his ideas. With this, he became accepted because of his obnoxious behavior that was loud spoken. Over time, his trolling increased and his f*ck level decreased, and now he where he is today.

So I believe the title can infact change people and, as a result, should be removed. Rep being removed was just the first step in putting everyone on the same playing field.[/quote]
AS IF ITS NOT BAD ENOUGH THEY REMOVED MY PRECIOUS REP NOW U WANT POST RANKS GONE TOO?
No way, there should be more actually

For example, let's look at team rocket. When he joined, he was immediately strongly out spoken with his ideas. With this, he became accepted because of his obnoxious behavior that was loud spoken. Over time, his trolling increased and his f*ck level decreased, and now he where he is today.
lol

Read full topic

item.title: Posts
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

reyx7:

For example, let’s look at team rocket. When he joined, he was immediately strongly out spoken with his ideas. With this, he became accepted because of his obnoxious behavior that was loud spoken. Over time, his trolling increased and his f*ck level decreased, and now he where he is today.

Wut.

On Topic: Post Count Rank doesn’t matter. It’s a useless feature (sort of) for Members. It’s just like Reputation; meaningless and too easy to achieve.

Read full topic

For example, let’s look at team rocket. When he joined, he was immediately strongly out spoken with his ideas. With this, he became accepted because of his obnoxious behavior that was loud spoken. Over time, his trolling increased and his f*ck level decreased, and now he where he is today.

So I believe the title can infact change people and, as a result, should be removed. Rep being removed was just the first step in putting everyone on the same playing field.[/quote]lol that’s pretty hilarious

item.title: Posts
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=reyx7 link=topic=584046.msg4157352#msg4157352 date=1352770701]There is a feeling of elitism by some foolish members, and typically discrimination towards newer members. Just saying it would eliminate these issues.

in my experience the ‘discrimination against newer members’ generally occurs when said newer member acts like an arrogant self-entitled pompous ass, this is not always the case but when newer members ask how to do something, ignoring the dozens of existing stickies and threads that will help him solve said problems they aren’t doing themselves any favours[/quote]
It just seems that there is a general lack of agreement with newer members, be they smart or dumb. People seem to just have less regard for the statements or actions they do unless they put themselves out there to prove worthiness. However, at a later period, change can be present in a negative term.

For example, let’s look at team rocket. When he joined, he was immediately strongly out spoken with his ideas. With this, he became accepted because of his obnoxious behavior that was loud spoken. Over time, his trolling increased and his f*ck level decreased, and now he where he is today.

So I believe the title can infact change people and, as a result, should be removed. Rep being removed was just the first step in putting everyone on the same playing field.

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:34, topic:467112”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=584046.msg4157274#msg4157274 date=1352768600]

We could just remove post ranks altogether in order to prevent the public from being expressed through rank and instead notoriety, removing the elitist system that flows through the forums.

Why do you care even care? My CM rank isn’t bringing me any respect, and shouldn’t either.
[/quote]

There is a feeling of elitism by some foolish members, and typically discrimination towards newer members. Just saying it would eliminate these issues.[/quote]OR

ban those members = no more issues
